Message: Hi, I’m the NewsBreak Ad Assistant. How can I help?
The user completes the submission of the form
hi Team How can I add funds to my account ?

Hi! To add funds to your News Break account, you can either use a credit card to purchase ad credits or set up autopay by adding your credit card on file. If you're looking for more detailed instructions, feel free to check out our Billing Guide here: [Billing Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17821681919757-Billing-Guide). Let me know if you have any other questions!
I need to add funds to the ad credit

To add funds to your ad credit, follow these steps:

1. Access the Billing Section in your account.
2. Under Ad Credits, click on ‘Add ad credits.’
3. Select the amount of ad credits you would like to purchase.
4. Provide your credit card information and proceed with the payment.

If you need more details, you can refer to our [Billing Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17821681919757-Billing-Guide). Let me know if there's anything else I can help with!
I'm not able to add as it shows I need to raise a ticket for this!

It seems like your account might not yet be eligible to add ad credits directly. To become eligible, your account needs to complete and pass business verification, and accumulate over $5,000 in spend. Additionally, you’ll need to establish a relationship with an Account Manager who can request the ad credit functionality for you.

If you believe this is an error or need further assistance, please contact our Ad Support team at adsupport@newsbreak.com. They'll be happy to help resolve this issue.

Thanks for your interest! At this time, dedicated account management is reserved for advertisers who meet a daily spend threshold of $1,000 or more. If you’re not at that level yet, no worries — our self-serve platform has everything you need to launch and optimize your campaigns successfully. Our support team is also available via chat or email if you need any help.

In the meantime, feel free to check out our Help Center — it’s a great resource for quick answers if you don’t need to reach out to support directly. And don’t forget to subscribe to our email updates and keep an eye out for our monthly webinar training sessions!

Let us know if you’d like assistance getting started.
